Posts.Content: About 6 months ago, I felt a lump in my breast, near my armpit. I saw by OBGYN, who said "You're young, and there is a lot of lumpy tissue there." I am 29, with no family history. Needless to say, I will not see that doctor again. Now I am having a discharge that comes out clear, but dries yellow, and a dimple. I don't know what I should do if it gets blown off again by my new doctor, who I have an appointment with Thursday. Have any of you felt like there was something wrong and demanded further disgnostic tests?
Posts.Title: "You're young," I am told

Posts.Content: Have an ultrasound next week. Because I also have an enlarged thyroid, coupled with the discharge (galactorrhea), they are looking at my prolactin levels. If high, could be a prolactinoma (tumor on the pituitary). Just something for those of you with discharge to be aware of, even though prolactinomas most likely are treatable with medication.
Posts.Title: "You're young," I am told

Posts.Content: I have always heard that it is hormonal. The same hormones that stimulate the "sloughing off" of the lining of the uterus also do the same to the lining of the intestines, increasing gastric motility.
Posts.Title: Diarrhea with periods?
